channel.title: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems
channel.description:
Looks like they will possibly offer compensation or a fix tommorow: http://www.product-reviews.net/2010/07/15/iphone-4-recall-and-special-apple-press-conference/
However, according to Damien Pearse from Sky News, he reports that Apple watchers believe that there will not be a recall – instead Apple will offer a solution to the issue. Charter Equity Research analyst, Ed Snyder believes that this will either be a fix or compensation for those who have purchased an iPhone 4. When Snyder mentions compensation we believe this to be a free Bumper, we will know more at 10A.M. PST on Friday. Apple could also mention the fact that they are working on an update, as last night they made available iOS 4.1 SDK update.

item.title: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ahahaha, I just saw the funniest Android app ever! Why can’t I ever think of innovative things like this?

[quote=“iPhone 4 Service Emulator”]Are you tired of your friends with iPhones getting all the cool new innovative features? Well now you can enjoy the same signal loss problems as the new iPhone 4.

Loses signal if you hold it upright. NOTE: If you lose service while using this application you are holding it wrong![/quote]
from:

appbrain.com

iPhone 4 Service Emulator - Android app on AppBrain

iPhone 4 Service Emulator: Android app (2.7 ★, 50,000+ downloads) → UPDATE: NOW WITH BUTTONS!!! Are you tired of your friends with iPhones getting all the cool new...

Isn’t that hilarious?

edit:
Bahaha, another funny:

I love the iPhone 4, if only for all the laughs it has given me.

Read full topic

item.source: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems

item.title: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It is slightly worse than other phones, which is what initially annoyed me. But there was a great deal of exaggeration, because of course it is an iPhone. I’m surprised Steve jobs didn’t use a Samsung jet in his comparisons, that would of been one to help his case - I have on sat here with me and I can get that to drop instantly to no-service. Whereas my iPhone 4 always holds a signal and never drops a call.

Free bumper… would of preferred a recall, just for lolsss.

EDIT: LoL - http://www.apple.com/antenna/

EDIT 2: The fan made video Apple played at the start of the conference: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VKIcaejkpD4

Read full topic

item.source: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems

item.title: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I don’t think suggesting a recall is that outlandish. Apple are about mindshare, their success is about mindshare - the fact this is getting so much attention with places like consumer report saying that they can’t recommend the phone till it is fixed, despite it being “The best smartphone on the market” as they said.

A replacement in store wouldn’t be that expensive in the long run, likely all they would be doing was replacing the frame, they could then take those turned in and replace their frames (and cases due to wear n tear) and give them as replacements to others.

Apple demand something like 25% profit margins on their products vs production, so really, they could definitely afford to do it. If they’ll do it is the question.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems

item.title: Apple call press conferance discussion Iphone 4 problems
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Looks like they will possibly offer compensation or a fix tommorow:

Product Reviews Net – 15 Jul 10

iPhone 4 Recall and Special Apple Press Conference

Apple has had a tough few weeks with the iPhone 4 and the continued problems with its antenna. The Cupertino company had not said much about the issue, which has angered iPhone 4 owners. However,

However, according to Damien Pearse from Sky News, he reports that Apple watchers believe that there will not be a recall – instead Apple will offer a solution to the issue. Charter Equity Research analyst, Ed Snyder believes that this will either be a fix or compensation for those who have purchased an iPhone 4.

When Snyder mentions compensation we believe this to be a free Bumper, we will know more at 10A.M. PST on Friday. Apple could also mention the fact that they are working on an update, as last night they made available iOS 4.1 SDK update.

Read full topic
